body:
I'm not sure if/how it's related to the RangeError, but with the stable Flutter SDK (2.2.1 / Dart 2.13.1)  the Dart Analysis seems to crash when I open a file with "generated parts"  ( I use freezed and json_serializable ). The symptoms are a broken syntax coloration, I can't jump to source...

Everything seems to works when : 
- I switch to the Flutter dev channel (2.3.0-16.0.pre /  Dart 2.14.0 (build 2.14.0-136.0.dev))
- I disable the flutter plugin, set the Dart plugin SDk to the "standalone Dart" path (.../dart/libexec -> Dart 2.13.3 ) and open a "pure Dart" package with generated files
- I open the package in VSCode

## Dart analysis issue

RangeError (index): Invalid value: Not in inclusive range 0..12: 13

## Version information

- Dart SDK 2.13.1
- Dart IntelliJ 211.7233
- IntelliJ IDEA 2021.1.2
- Mac OS X 10.15.7

## Details

RangeError (index): Invalid value: Not in inclusive range 0..12: 13


comment_data.body: Closing as the problem seems to be solved with the 2.2.2 stable release ( Dart 1.13.3 )

title: Dart analysis issue: RangeError (index): Invalid value: Not in inclusive range 0..12: 13
